document.comment: Generated automatically from Godot engine sources.

section.title: Curve
section.paragraph: A mathematical curve.

section.title: Description
section.paragraph: This resource describes a mathematical curve by defining a set of points and tangents at each point. By default, it ranges between 0 and 1 on the X and Y axes, but these ranges can be changed.

Please note that many resources and nodes assume they are given unit curves. A unit curve is a curve whose domain (the X axis) is between 0 and 1. Some examples of unit curve usage are CPUParticles2D.angle_curve and Line2D.width_curve.

entry.paragraph: add_point(position: Vector2, left_tangent: float = 0, right_tangent: float = 0, left_mode: TangentMode = 0, right_mode: TangentMode = 0)

section.title: Signals
section.paragraph: domain_changed() ðŸ”—
Emitted when max_domain or min_domain is changed.
range_changed() ðŸ”—
Emitted when max_value or min_value is changed.

section.title: Enumerations
section.paragraph: enum TangentMode: ðŸ”—
TangentMode TANGENT_FREE = 0
The tangent on this side of the point is user-defined.
TangentMode TANGENT_LINEAR = 1
The curve calculates the tangent on this side of the point as the slope halfway towards the adjacent point.
TangentMode TANGENT_MODE_COUNT = 2
The total number of available tangent modes.

section.title: Property Descriptions
section.paragraph: int bake_resolution = 100 ðŸ”—
The number of points to include in the baked (i.e. cached) curve data.
float max_domain = 1.0 ðŸ”—
The maximum domain (x-coordinate) that points can have.
float max_value = 1.0 ðŸ”—
The maximum value (y-coordinate) that points can have. Tangents can cause higher values between points.
float min_domain = 0.0 ðŸ”—
The minimum domain (x-coordinate) that points can have.
float min_value = 0.0 ðŸ”—
The minimum value (y-coordinate) that points can have. Tangents can cause lower values between points.
int point_count = 0 ðŸ”—
The number of points describing the curve.

section.title: Method Descriptions
section.paragraph: int add_point(position: Vector2, left_tangent: float = 0, right_tangent: float = 0, left_mode: TangentMode = 0, right_mode: TangentMode = 0) ðŸ”—

Adds a point to the curve. For each side, if the *_mode is TANGENT_LINEAR, the *_tangent angle (in degrees) uses the slope of the curve halfway to the adjacent point. Allows custom assignments to the *_tangent angle if *_mode is set to TANGENT_FREE.
void bake() ðŸ”—
Recomputes the baked cache of points for the curve.
void clean_dupes() ðŸ”—
Removes duplicate points, i.e. points that are less than 0.00001 units (engine epsilon value) away from their neighbor on the curve.
void clear_points() ðŸ”—
Removes all points from the curve.
float get_domain_range() const ðŸ”—
Returns the difference between min_domain and max_domain.
TangentMode get_point_left_mode(index: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the left TangentMode for the point at index.
float get_point_left_tangent(index: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the left tangent angle (in degrees) for the point at index.
Vector2 get_point_position(index: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the curve coordinates for the point at index.
TangentMode get_point_right_mode(index: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the right TangentMode for the point at index.
float get_point_right_tangent(index: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the right tangent angle (in degrees) for the point at index.
float get_value_range() const ðŸ”—
Returns the difference between min_value and max_value.
void remove_point(index: int) ðŸ”—
Removes the point at index from the curve.
float sample(offset: float) const ðŸ”—
Returns the Y value for the point that would exist at the X position offset along the curve.
float sample_baked(offset: float) const ðŸ”—
Returns the Y value for the point that would exist at the X position offset along the curve using the baked cache. Bakes the curve's points if not already baked.
void set_point_left_mode(index: int, mode: TangentMode) ðŸ”—
Sets the left TangentMode for the point at index to mode.
void set_point_left_tangent(index: int, tangent: float) ðŸ”—
Sets the left tangent angle for the point at index to tangent.
int set_point_offset(index: int, offset: float) ðŸ”—
Sets the offset from 0.5.
void set_point_right_mode(index: int, mode: TangentMode) ðŸ”—
Sets the right TangentMode for the point at index to mode.
void set_point_right_tangent(index: int, tangent: float) ðŸ”—
Sets the right tangent angle for the point at index to tangent.
void set_point_value(index: int, y: float) ðŸ”—
Assigns the vertical position y to the point at index.
